The emperor of the three worlds, the one who has no match in kingship.

Concerning the devadānas of the Lord, the Lord of Tirucciṟṟampalam, to the nāṭavars of the Irācātirācavaḷanāṭṭu, ...
for Irācākka Nāyaṉār, whom we had, in our name, graciously installed on the bank the glorious pond inside the temple of the glorious Lord of Tōṇipuram, the Lord of Tirukaḻumalam, in their nāṭu, and
for Nācciyār Marakata Cokkiyār
for the purpose of
... canti,
... tōppu,
... tōppaiṭṭakaḷ,
... nampimār,
... maṭam,
the land that we gave iṭṭa, according to our leaf ōlaip paṭiThat is, an order written on palm leaves. ... is thirty vēlis.
